meanings.definition: To fail to suit or be appropriate.
meanings.sent1: Her casual shoes missuit the formal dress.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors missuit the somber occasion.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at humor missuited the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The rainy weather missuited our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The mismatched socks missuit his otherwise impeccable outfit.

meanings.definition: A garment or outfit that does not fit properly.
meanings.sent1: The missuit was too tight around the waist.
meanings.sent2: She returned the missuit because the sleeves were too short.
meanings.sent3: The missuit made him look like a clown at the party.
meanings.sent4: The missuit hung awkwardly on her frame.
meanings.sent5: He felt self-conscious in the ill-fitting missuit.
